column2: Degeneration of tendon's collagen in response to chronic overuse. Can take up to 6 months or longer to heal. About 80% of people eventually heal.
The most common type of arthritis. Caused by normal wear and tear, the cartilage deteriorates or even disappears, resulting in bone-on-bone contact.
a painful condition caused by rubbing or pressure on a tendon, nerve, etc by adjacent structures
Shots that can relieve pain and inflammation in specific area of body. Usually injected into joints, and accompanied by local anesthetic.
